metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1943 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The KVM subsystem in the Linux kernel before 3.0 does not check whetherkernel addresses are specified during allocation of memory slots for use ina guest's physical address space, which allows local users to gainprivileges or obtain sensitive information from kernel memory via a craftedapplication, related to arch/x86/kvm/paging_tmpl.h and virt/kvm/kvm_main.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.7
No subscription required

linux-image-3.1.10-8-grouper - 3.1.10-8.28
No subscription required

linux-image-3.0.0-3-maguro - 3.0.0-3.18
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-3-mako - 3.4.0-3.21
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-4-manta - 3.4.0-4.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required
